item.title: German Manufacturing Orders Unexpectedly Rise
item.description: New orders at German factories rose 0.2% in September, offering some hope for the stricken manufacturing sector, which has been blamed for stagnation in the wider economy.

item.title: Bullish Bond Market Momentum Is in for a Reality Check
item.description: The bullish momentum in bond markets and aggressive rate cut pricing is in for a reality check amid little data and a raft of central bank speeches this week, Commerzbank Research said.

item.title: Singapore's DBS Takes a Hit from Money-Laundering Affair
item.description: DBS is financially exposed to the tune of around S$100 million to a recent money-laundering scandal in the city-state, its CEO said.

item.title: Ryanair Profits Soar, Plans Regular Payouts
item.description: Ryanair posted a sharply higher net profit for the first half 2024 as traffic grew 11%, forecast a record annual profit of up to €2 billion and said it would pay regular dividends starting next year.

item.title: BOJ Gov. Ueda Suggests Low Possibility of Negative Rates Ending This Year
item.description: The central bank would continue the negative interest rate and yield curve control until a sustainable and stable achievement of its 2% inflation target comes into sight, Bank of Japan Gov. Kazuo Ueda said.

item.title: Nikkei Rises 2.4%, Led by Electronics Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks ended higher, led by gains in electronics stocks, as concerns eased about borrowing costs following soft U.S. jobs data on Friday.

item.title: The Workers Who Make Your Clothes Want Higher Pay. Who Should Pony Up?
item.description: The armies of people who make clothes for Western brands are protesting for better wages, adding pressure to the era of ultracheap clothes on which many companies rely.

item.title: How Russia Games Oil Sanctions for Big Profits
item.description: Moscow has found ways to circumvent the G-7 oil-price cap, moving crude on a fleet of aging tankers on which sanctions have limited traction.

item.title: Foreign Firms Pull Billions in Earnings Out of China
item.description: For years, foreign companies plowed the profits they made in China back into the country. Not anymore.

item.title: Leading Western brands in China are feeling the pinch from the country's consumer slump, with some saying customers aren't reopening their wallets almost a year after Covid-related isolation ended.
item.description: Leading Western brands in China are feeling the pinch from the country’s consumer slump, with some saying customers aren’t reopening their wallets almost a year after Covid-related isolation ended.

item.title: LVMH agreed to buy Los Angeles-based eyewear maker Barton Perreira, part of the luxury conglomerate's push to extend its reach to goods with mass-market appeal.
item.description: LVMH agreed to buy Los Angeles-based eyewear maker Barton Perreira, part of the luxury conglomerate’s push to extend its reach to goods with mass-market appeal.

item.title: A Westernprice cap on Russian oilmeant to curb Moscow's war spending is increasingly losing its punch and U.S. officials are scrambling to shore up their experimental intervention in global oil markets.
item.description: A Western price cap on Russian oil meant to curb Moscow’s war spending is increasingly losing its punch and U.S. officials are scrambling to shore up their experimental intervention in global oil markets.

item.title: Moscow said a Ukrainian strike damaged a Russian ship moored in occupied Crimea, the latest sign that Ukraine's stepped-up attacks are dealing further blows to the Russian Navy.
item.description: Moscow said a Ukrainian strike damaged a Russian ship moored in occupied Crimea, the latest sign that Ukraine’s stepped-up attacks are dealing further blows to the Russian Navy.

item.title: Trump is expected to take the witness stand in a civil-fraud trial that has featured increasingly charged exchanges between his lawyers and a judge who could cripple his business empire.
item.description: Trump is expected to take the witness stand in a civil-fraud trial that has featured increasingly charged exchanges between his lawyers and a judge who could cripple his business empire.

item.title: Elon Musk demonstrated his AI startup's first product: a bot named Grok which will be made available to Premium+ subscribers to the X social-media platform after testing.
item.description: Elon Musk demonstrated his AI startup’s first product: a bot named Grok which will be made available to Premium+ subscribers to the X social-media platform after testing.

item.title: The Washington Post named former Dow Jones Chief Executive William Lewis as its CEO and publisher.
item.description: The Washington Post named former Dow Jones Chief Executive William Lewis as its CEO and publisher.

item.title: The U.S. is rushing to support Middle East leaders facing domestic turmoil over the Israel-Hamas conflict, with Secretary of State Antony Blinken making two surprise visits to the West Bank and Iraq, as the Biden administration comes under pressure to secure a pause in the fighting and ease regional tensions.
item.description: The U.S. is rushing to support Middle East leaders facing domestic turmoil over the Israel-Hamas conflict, with Secretary of State Antony Blinken making two surprise visits to the West Bank and Iraq, as the Biden administration comes under pressure to secure a pause in the fighting and ease regional tensions.

item.title: Earnings for the biggest U.S. companies are set to show their first collective increase in a year, helped in part by consumers' strong summer spending.
item.description: Earnings for the biggest U.S. companies are set to show their first collective increase in a year, helped in part by consumers’ strong summer spending.

item.title: Sexually explicit pamphlets and accusations of lying have punctuated a partisan campaign for control of Pennsylvania's third-largest school district.
item.description: Sexually explicit pamphlets and accusations of lying have punctuated a partisan campaign for control of Pennsylvania’s third-largest school district.

item.title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway ended the third quarter with a record cash pile and reported a deeper net loss due to the sputtering stock-market rally.
item.description: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway ended the third quarter with a record cash pile and reported a deeper net loss due to the sputtering stock-market rally.
